title: Consuming Jakarta EE REST Services with React
content: This tutorial will show how to build a powerful combination: a React frontend that seamlessly interacts with data from a Jakarta EE REST backend application running as a WildFly bootable JAR. Prerequisites: Step # 1 Define the Rest Endpoint Firstly, bootstrap a Jakarta EE application. You can either use WildFly archetypes ( see Maven archetype ...  The post appeared first on .
